Text: Bristol democratically voted in 2017 by 57% to keep the statue of Edward Colston in it's place. Yet the police, politicians & government stood by & watched it ripped down & thrown into the water just to appease political correctness & for fear of being incorrectly labeled racist

The argument that you can be in favour of the BLM movement and disapprove of the way the Colston statue came down is symptomatic of the systemic bias that the movement is highlighting. Multiple petitions tried and failed to remove that monument to slavery. The system had failed.

The day Bristol dumped its hated slave trader in the docks & a nation began to search its soul. When Edward Colston’s statue was toppled, colonialism & national memory became a part of the Black Lives Matter conversation. But what will change in the city?

Most protesters on both sides are vandalising and rioting because they enjoy it . Not one petition to rightfully remove Colston's Statue ever reached more than a thousand votes . If a petition of around 20,000 had been handed in peacefully and publicly , it would be taken down

Whipping up a storm around this to distract from the issue. Was the statue vandalised? - yes. Was it wrong? - yes. Has it been vandalised before? YES. No one really expects the statue to be taken down, nor is it a legitimate target in the same way as Edward Colston's. Non-story.

Note also the misleading spin (and the Guardian is either part of it or doesn't notice it). It's not just about "vandalising war memorials". It's about any monument. So something like the toppling of the Colston statue would be punishable with 10 years jail too.

4 of 10 [Statues vs statutes] Even Starmer has said the Colston statue should come down, but by due process, not by vandalism. Recourse to any meaningful justice is shrinking rapidly even despite many legal professions warning about the possible dire consequences.

3 of 10 [Statues vs statutes] The Edward Colston statue was brought down after years of attempts by the community to have it removed. Voices are stifled by an overweight dysfunctional failing bureaucracy.

“erase our history” Did the toppling of Colston’s statue (erected 200 years after he lived) ‘erase’ his history? Where is the history of the slaves he profited from? Where is the history of our fellow UK citizens who are not white?
